org.divxdede.swing.busy

Class FutureBusyModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.DefaultBoundedRangeModel
      • org.divxdede.swing.busy.DefaultBusyModel
        • org.divxdede.swing.busy.FutureBusyModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, BoundedRangeModel, Disposable, BusyModel

    public class FutureBusyModel
extends DefaultBusyModel
implements Disposable
    A BusyModel implementation allowing to reflet the execution of a Future task. While the job task underlying the Future is running, this model will be set to a busy state.

    Use setFuture for defining the Future to reflet.
    Since SwingWorker is also a Future, you can bound a SwingWorker to this model.
    When you bound a SwingWorker to this model, this model will be determinate and use the SwingWorker.getProgress()

    When you don't need anymore to use this model, you must invoke dispose() in order to free all threading resources.

    Author:
    André Sébastien (divxdede)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void setFuture(Future future)
        Reflet a new Future to reflet. This model will be set as undeterminate but cancellable model.
        Parameters:

      • setBusy

        public final void setBusy(boolean value)
        You can't define the busy state manually on a FutureBusyModel Use instead the setFuture(Future) for define which task to track.
        Specified by:
        setBusy in interface BusyModel
        Overrides:
        setBusy in class DefaultBusyModel
        Parameters:
        value - true to going in a busy state

      • setFuture

        public void setFuture(Future future,
             boolean cancellable)
        Reflet a new Future to reflet. This model will be set as undeterminate and cancellable if specified.
        Parameters:
        future - New Future to reflet.
        cancellable - true for let this future cancellable by the JBusyComponent
